sense.name: a physical network of interwoven strands
sense.examples: We admired a spider web on the porch, gleaming in the sunlight. This type of skin graft technology places a web of cultivated tissue over a burn. The trees cast a delicate web of shadows over the lawn.

sense.name: a state or situation of entrapment
sense.examples: He was finally caught in a web of lies. The entrepreneur had to fight through a web of bureaucracy to obtain a license.

sense.name: a network of interconnected distributed units
sense.examples: That grocery chain has established a web of stores throughout the midwest. John needs to expand his social web of friends and colleagues.

sense.name: interconnected computer or internet sites
sense.commentary: WEB[+system][+interconnected][+distributed][+units][+site][+internet] Note: This is probably a proper name, so should be omitted.
sense.examples: I found interesting European furniture on the web. The web has created many new business opportunities.

sense.name: connective membrane between toes of some animals
sense.examples: The web of a duck's feet helps it to swim more efficiently. Labrador Retrievers have web between their toes which makes them good swimmers.

sense.name: flattened barbs radiating from shaft of a feather
sense.examples: We examined the webs on the eagle feather.

sense.name: metal plate that connects flanges of a rail or girder
sense.examples: The webs on these girders are made of steel.

sense.name: continuous roll of manufactured substance
sense.examples: This heavy web is used for newspaper print. The web in the paper-making machine got a tear in it and the process had to be halted.

sense.name: woven fabric in bulk
sense.examples: The inspector of the shop floor examined the webs on the automated looms.
